AstraZeneca

Harnessing knowledge

AZ had 200 million documents. If you printed them all out they would weigh more than the Titanic.

But you needed 100 different applications to search them all.

Imagine having to remember 100 different passwords just to search documents at work.

We built a framework that gave users a single search application - that searches all the documents for them.

The app works on phones, tablets and PCs and requires no training to use.

Each month 417,000 new scientific papers uploaded digitally, that’s enough paper to wallpaper the great pyramid of Giza every 2 days.

AstraZeneca

Turbo-charging innovation

AZ ran innovation competitions for new ideas, they attracted a relatively small group of people. The ideas were always submitted as lengthy academic documents which limited the number of people capable of suggesting or appraising ideas.

So they missed out on the power of the collective brainpower available.

We developed a collaborative innovation tool, creating a place where new ideas can be captured, shared and appraised anytime, anywhere by anyone

Ideas start out as 140 character chunks. The crowd vote on the most attractive and only those selected by the crowd are developed any further.

All participants get rewarded for being involved. This gets more people than ever from within the organisation involved in innovation.

Ideas are improved by wider collaboration into more rounded concepts, making the real-world application of the ideas more likely.

RecoAuto

Creating a smarter market

Cars are being written off by insurers because they replace old parts with new ones. Old parts are not used because they are hard to source and they are not catalogued in same way as the new parts.

Car which is not viable to repair with new parts could be if old parts were available.

On average insurers are overpaying by £300* [Competition Commission] for their repairs, driving up insurance premiums.

By always using new parts the industry pays around £44M extra for accident repair each year

We are creating a system that allows vehicle breakers to match parts to repairers’ needs.

By matching the new part database with breakers’ databases, repairers can instantly get a quote for second-hand parts for a complete repair.

Repairers pay for parts which are promptly delivered to their workshops. This saves insurers money, lower insurance premiums for drivers and is better for the environment

Bede Gaming Ltd

A new breed of gaming platform

Our client used to invent and market games for itself and its customers using the industry standard gaming platform.

But they were never satisfied with the quality of the service of the software they were buying in from the platform provider - as a small company they were considered a ‘rounding error’.

So they joined forces with pebble {code} to build a new software platform, delivering their own industry leading games, and integrating best of breed games from other content suppliers

We build a highly flexible platform, allowing the people to customise and adapt their products while allowing gamers the freedom to play games on any device
